BALTIMORE, MD 21201

citations.narrative:
During a review of IACUC records, an adverse event was found involving the injury and subsequent death of a rabbit after
falling from its enclosure. On June 28, 2024, a technician collected a blood sample from rabbit #RB11 and did not
properly secure the cage door when preparing the sample which allowed the animal to fall from its enclosure. The
technician immediately alerted the veterinary staff of the incident and the animal was quickly evaluated. A veterinarian
confirmed that the rabbit's lower limbs were paralyzed from the fall, and the animal was euthanized.
Failure to properly secure enclosures can allow for escape or entrapment of animals which can result in injury or death.
Handling of all animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma,
overheating, excessive cooling, behavioral stress, physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort.
Corrected before the time of inspection (11/12/2024) through a corrective action plan.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
GLORIA MCFADDEN, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.38(f)(1)  Critical
   
Miscellaneous. 
During a review of IACUC records, an adverse event was found involving the injury and subsequent death of a rabbit after 
falling from its enclosure. On June 28, 2024, a technician collected a blood sample from rabbit #RB11 and did not 
properly secure the cage door when preparing the sample which allowed the animal to fall from its enclosure. The 
technician immediately alerted the veterinary staff of the incident and the animal was quickly evaluated. A veterinarian 
confirmed that the rabbit's lower limbs were paralyzed from the fall, and the animal was euthanized.  
Failure to properly secure enclosures can allow for escape or entrapment of animals which can result in injury or death.  
Handling of all animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma, 
overheating, excessive cooling, behavioral stress, physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort.  
Corrected before the time of inspection (11/12/2024) through a corrective action plan. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
GLORIA MCFADDEN, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
